definitions: relating to or functioning as an adjective in grammar; describing or qualifying nouns
serving to modify, describe, or limit the meaning of a noun or pronoun
examples: The adjective phrase modifies the noun in this sentence
She studied adjective clauses in her grammar course
His adjective descriptions made the story more vivid
The writer used adjective language to enhance imagery

definitions: attached or added to something but not essentially a part of it; supplementary
holding a temporary or auxiliary position, especially in an academic institution
examples: The adjunct materials provide extra practice for students
She serves as an adjunct member of the committee
He works as an adjunct professor at the university
The adjunct faculty teach specialized courses each semester

definitions: capable of being adjusted, altered, or adapted to different conditions or requirements
able to be changed in size, position, or degree to suit different needs
examples: The adjustable chair provides better ergonomic support
This adjustable wrench fits various bolt sizes
The loan has adjustable interest rates that vary monthly
Her adjustable schedule allows for flexible working hours

definitions: changed or modified to suit particular conditions or requirements; calibrated or corrected
emotionally or psychologically adapted to circumstances; having achieved psychological balance
examples: The adjusted figures show the actual profit margins
She wore adjusted glasses that corrected her vision
The well-adjusted child thrives in the new school
After therapy, he became more adjusted to daily stress

definitions: relating to the management or organization of an institution, business, or government department
concerned with or responsible for administration rather than policy-making or operations
examples: Administrative duties take up most of her working day
The administrative staff handles all paperwork and scheduling
He holds an administrative position in the company
Administrative costs have increased significantly this year

definitions: deserving respect, approval, or admiration for good qualities or achievements
excellent in quality or execution; inspiring approval and respect
examples: Her admirable courage inspired everyone around her
The team showed admirable dedication to the project
The chef's admirable skill created an unforgettable meal
His admirable performance earned him a standing ovation

definitions: regarded with respect, approval, or warm appreciation for qualities or achievements
looked up to and respected by others; held in high esteem
examples: The admired author received numerous literary awards
She is an admired figure in the scientific community
The admired teacher influenced generations of students
His admired leadership style motivated the entire team

definitions: acceptable or valid, especially as evidence in a court of law
able to be admitted or allowed; meeting the requirements for acceptance
examples: The judge ruled the evidence admissible in court
Only admissible testimony will be considered by the jury
Admissible candidates must meet all qualification requirements
The admissible solution falls within the specified parameters

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the period between childhood and adulthood; teenage
displaying immature or childish behavior typical of adolescence; lacking adult maturity
examples: Adolescent development involves significant physical and emotional changes
The clinic specializes in adolescent mental health issues
His adolescent behavior embarrassed his older colleagues
Their adolescent jokes grew tiresome during the meeting

definitions: legally taken and raised as one's own child when not biologically related
formally chosen, accepted, or put into practice; taken up and used
examples: Their adopted daughter came from overseas orphanage
The adopted children maintain contact with birth families
The newly adopted policy improves workplace efficiency
The adopted resolution passed with unanimous support

definitions: relating to or involving the legal adoption of a child
having legally adopted a child; serving as parent through adoption
examples: The adoptive process requires extensive background checks
Adoptive families receive support from social services
Her adoptive parents raised her with love and care
The adoptive mother bonded instantly with the baby

definitions: inspiring great affection or delight; charming and endearing in appearance or behavior
extremely attractive or appealing in a sweet, innocent, or endearing way
examples: The adorable puppy melted everyone's hearts immediately
She wore an adorable dress to the party
The toddler's adorable antics made everyone laugh
They decorated the nursery with adorable animal prints

definitions: loved deeply and tenderly; regarded with deep, often rapturous love
worshipped or honored as divine; regarded with reverent admiration
examples: The adored grandmother was the family's emotional center
His adored wife inspired his greatest poetry
The adored leader commanded absolute loyalty from followers
The adored deity received daily offerings at the temple

definitions: showing deep love, admiration, or devotion; expressing intense affection
showing worshipful devotion or reverent admiration; extremely devoted
examples: Her adoring gaze followed him across the room
The adoring fans waited hours for an autograph
The adoring crowd cheered their hero's every move
His adoring followers hung on his every word

definitions: decorated or enhanced with ornaments, jewels, or other decorative elements
made more attractive or impressive by adding decorative details or accessories
examples: The adorned Christmas tree sparkled with lights and ornaments
She wore an adorned gown covered in sequins
The adorned manuscript featured elaborate golden illustrations
The adorned temple walls displayed intricate carvings

definitions: floating without being moored or steered; drifting at the mercy of wind and current
without purpose, direction, or guidance; feeling lost or disconnected from stability
examples: The boat was found adrift miles from the shore
Several containers fell overboard and were adrift at sea
She felt adrift after losing her job unexpectedly
The company seemed adrift without strong leadership

definitions: skillful and clever in using the hands or mind; demonstrating dexterity
quick and skillful in thought or resourcefulness; mentally agile and clever
examples: The adroit surgeon completed the delicate operation successfully
Her adroit handling of tools impressed the instructor
His adroit response deflected the difficult question
The adroit negotiator secured favorable terms for everyone

definitions: fully grown or developed; having reached maturity or legal age of majority
intended for or restricted to mature audiences; containing mature themes or content
examples: Adult elephants can weigh up to six tons
The program offers adult education classes every evening
The movie received an adult rating for violence
This adult content requires parental guidance warnings

definitions: made impure by adding inferior or foreign substances; contaminated or diluted
corrupted, debased, or made inferior in quality; not genuine or authentic
examples: The adulterated milk contained harmful chemicals
Adulterated drugs pose serious health risks to patients
The adulterated version lost the original's artistic integrity
Their adulterated traditions barely resemble ancient practices

definitions: involving or characterized by adultery; relating to sexual infidelity in marriage
engaging in sexual relations with someone other than one's spouse; sexually unfaithful
examples: The adulterous affair destroyed their twenty-year marriage
She filed for divorce citing adulterous behavior
His adulterous relationship became public during the scandal
The novel explores an adulterous liaison in Victorian society

definitions: done, sent, or supplied beforehand; made or given ahead of time
going before in place or time; moving forward or progressive in nature
examples: Advance notice helps people prepare for the meeting
The advance payment secured their reservation
The advance guard cleared the path for troops
Advance technology revolutionized the manufacturing process

definitions: far on or ahead in development, progress, or complexity; highly sophisticated
at a higher level of difficulty, proficiency, or education than elementary
far along in time, course, or progress; late in development
examples: Advanced technology enables faster communication worldwide
The hospital uses advanced medical equipment
She enrolled in advanced mathematics courses this semester
Advanced students can skip the introductory lessons
The advanced stage of disease requires immediate treatment
In his advanced years, he wrote his memoirs

definitions: moving forward in space or position; approaching or coming nearer
making progress or developing; increasing in extent, intensity, or quality
examples: The advancing army forced villagers to evacuate
She watched the advancing storm clouds with concern
His advancing career required frequent relocations
The advancing technology makes older models obsolete

definitions: providing an advantage or benefit; favorable to success or a desired outcome
placing in a superior or more favorable position; conferring advantage
examples: The advantageous location attracts many customers daily
This advantageous deal saves the company thousands
Her advantageous position gave her insider information
The advantageous timing helped secure the contract

definitions: happening by chance rather than design; accidental or not inherent
growing from an unusual part of a plant; developing in an abnormal position
examples: The adventitious discovery led to a breakthrough cure
Their adventitious meeting changed both their lives
Adventitious roots grew from the plant's stem
The adventitious buds developed after the injury

definitions: willing to take risks or try new and difficult experiences; bold and daring
involving new, exciting, or dangerous experiences; full of adventure
examples: The adventurous traveler explored remote mountain regions
Her adventurous spirit led her to start her own business
They planned an adventurous expedition through the jungle
The adventurous menu features exotic ingredients

definitions: relating to or functioning as an adverb in grammar; modifying verbs
having the nature or function of an adverb; serving to modify or qualify
examples: The adverbial phrase modifies the main verb
Students studied adverbial clauses in grammar class
Her adverbial use of adjectives confused the readers
The adverbial element adds important contextual information

definitions: preventing success or development; harmful, unfavorable, or antagonistic in effect
acting against or in a contrary direction; opposed or hostile
examples: Adverse weather conditions delayed the flight departure
The drug caused adverse reactions in some patients
The adverse party filed an appeal against the decision
They faced adverse opinions from the board members

definitions: publicly announced or described, especially in media; made known widely
promoted through advertising to increase sales or awareness; commercially marketed
examples: The advertised position attracted hundreds of applicants
The advertised features weren't available in the product
The heavily advertised movie broke box office records
Their advertised specials bring customers every weekend

definitions: wise, prudent, or sensible to do; worthy of being recommended or suggested
to be recommended or desirable in the interests of safety, success, or well-being
examples: It's advisable to book tickets well in advance
Regular exercise is advisable for maintaining good health
Taking insurance is advisable for international travel
It's advisable to consult a lawyer before signing

definitions: recommended or suggested as a course of action; given as counsel
carefully considered or thought out; done with deliberation and wisdom
examples: The advised treatment includes rest and medication
She followed the advised protocol for the procedure
His advised decision came after lengthy deliberation
The well-advised investor avoided the risky venture

definitions: having the power or function to advise but not to enforce decisions
serving in a consultative capacity; providing recommendations or guidance
examples: The advisory committee meets quarterly to review policies
She serves in an advisory capacity to the board
The weather service issued an advisory warning
Advisory services help students plan their careers

definitions: supplied or charged with air or gas; having air incorporated throughout
made effervescent or bubbly by charging with carbon dioxide or air
examples: The aerated soil promotes better root growth
Aerated concrete provides excellent insulation properties
The aerated drinks fizzed when opened
She prefers aerated water with her meals

definitions: existing, happening, or operating in the air; relating to aircraft
taken from or viewed from above; involving a bird's-eye perspective
relating to or functioning as an antenna for receiving radio or television signals
examples: The aerial display featured synchronized acrobatic maneuvers
Aerial photography captured the landscape's full beauty
The aerial view revealed hidden archaeological sites
They conducted an aerial survey of the damage
The aerial cable needs adjustment for better reception
She installed a new aerial on the roof

definitions: requiring or using oxygen for life or combustion; occurring in the presence of oxygen
relating to exercise that improves cardiovascular fitness by increasing oxygen consumption
examples: Aerobic bacteria break down organic matter in compost
The aerobic process produces more energy than anaerobic
She attends aerobic classes three times a week
Aerobic exercise strengthens the heart and lungs

definitions: designed to reduce air resistance and improve movement through air; streamlined
relating to the properties of moving air and the forces acting on bodies in motion
examples: The aerodynamic design reduces fuel consumption significantly
Racing cars have aerodynamic bodies for maximum speed
Aerodynamic principles guide aircraft wing design
The aerodynamic forces affect the vehicle's stability

definitions: relating to the science or practice of building and flying aircraft
concerned with or relating to aeronautics or aviation
examples: His aeronautic expertise helped design safer aircraft
The aeronautic industry drives technological innovation
Aeronautic principles govern all flight operations
She pursued aeronautic studies at the academy

definitions: relating to the science, design, and manufacture of aircraft and spacecraft
concerning the theory and practice of navigation through air or space
examples: She earned her aeronautical engineering degree last year
The aeronautical museum displays historic aircraft
Aeronautical charts guide pilots through airspace
The aeronautical innovations revolutionized air travel

definitions: concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty; relating to visual appearance
relating to the philosophy or principles of what is beautiful in art
examples: The aesthetic appeal of the building attracts tourists
She made aesthetic improvements to the garden design
His aesthetic sensibility influenced modern architecture
The aesthetic principles guide their artistic choices

definitions: friendly, good-natured, and easy to talk to; pleasantly sociable
showing warmth and friendliness; gracious and approachable in manner
examples: The affable host made everyone feel welcome
His affable manner put nervous patients at ease
The affable professor encouraged student questions
Her affable personality made her popular with colleagues

definitions: influenced or changed by something; acted upon or altered by external factors
artificial and designed to impress; not natural or genuine in manner
examples: The affected areas need immediate disaster relief
Affected employees will receive compensation packages
Her affected accent annoyed her former classmates
His affected sophistication fooled no one

definitions: producing strong emotions, especially sadness or sympathy; touching or moving
having an effect on; producing change or influence in something
examples: The affecting story brought tears to many eyes
Her affecting performance earned a standing ovation
Factors affecting climate include ocean currents
The affecting circumstances changed their decision

definitions: readily showing fondness, tenderness, or love; warmly attached
characterized by or displaying love, fondness, or tender feelings
examples: The affectionate mother hugged her children daily
Their affectionate relationship lasted fifty years
The affectionate letter expressed his true feelings
She gave him an affectionate pat on the shoulder

definitions: relating to moods, feelings, and emotions; concerning emotional states
relating to or arising from affects or emotions rather than thought
examples: Affective disorders include depression and anxiety
The therapist addressed affective responses to trauma
His affective state influenced his decision-making
Affective learning engages students' emotions

definitions: officially attached to or connected with an organization, especially as a subsidiary
closely associated with or controlled by a parent organization or group
examples: The affiliated hospitals share medical resources
She works for an affiliated marketing company
All affiliated members receive monthly newsletters
The affiliated university offers exchange programs

definitions: expressing agreement, consent, or approval; saying yes or confirming
positive in nature; asserting that something is true or valid
examples: She gave an affirmative response to the proposal
The committee voted in the affirmative
The test showed affirmative results for the condition
He took affirmative steps to resolve the issue

definitions: attached, fastened, or stuck to something; firmly fixed in position
added or appended to something, especially as a signature or seal
examples: The affixed label contains important safety information
A stamp must be affixed to the envelope
Her affixed signature validated the legal document
The affixed seal proves the document's authenticity

definitions: suffering from an illness, disability, or other medical condition
troubled, distressed, or caused to suffer by something harmful
examples: The afflicted patients require specialized medical care
She cared for her afflicted brother with patience
The afflicted regions struggled with drought and famine
His afflicted conscience kept him awake at night

definitions: having a great deal of money or wealth; financially prosperous
flowing in abundance; copious or plentiful in supply
examples: The affluent neighborhood features luxury homes
Affluent investors dominate the stock market
The affluent stream provided water year-round
An affluent supply of resources supported growth

definitions: priced within one's financial means; not expensive relative to income
able to be afforded or paid for without financial hardship
examples: The affordable housing program helps low-income families
They found affordable options for their vacation
Healthcare should be affordable for all citizens
The restaurant offers affordable meals without compromising quality
